creator: gabrielmd@gmail.com
text:
Hello,

  I'm reporting a error at PHP module that I have found when I did a upload.
  I'll try to explain: If I have a file with the name "file.php.tx" the server will open it like a simple PHP file. This situation occurs when the second extension isn't recognized from the server (e.g. ".aaa", ".rb", etc).
  It occurs also with the ".phtml" and ".php3" files since the same module is used.

  I hope that you can solve it bearing in mind that many systems aren't prevent with this.

  Thanks.

creator: nick@webthing.com
text: This is normal, and is a matter of how you configure it.  If it's not what you want, please seek help in a support forum over whatever you have trouble with in the manual.

creator: gabrielmd@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> This is normal, and is a matter of how you configure it.  If it's not what you
> want, please seek help in a support forum over whatever you have trouble with
> in the manual.
> 

Please, can you help me where I find another configuration matter?
